external_references.description: Hastings, M. (2014, July 16). Investigating PowerShell Attacks. Retrieved December 1, 2021.

objects.description: Monitor contextual data about a running process, which may include information such as environment variables, image name, user/owner, or other information that may reveal use of a version of system features that may be outdated, vulnerable, and/or does not support updated security controls such as logging. For example, monitoring for Windows event ID (EID) 400, specifically the EngineVersion field which shows the version of PowerShell running, may highlight a malicious downgrade attack.(Citation: inv_ps_attacks)
